alert.note: Alert for Greensville; Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Greensville, west central Southampton and southwestern Sussex Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jarratt, or 7 miles east of Purdy, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Greensville, west central Southampton and southwestern Sussex Counties, including the following locations... Adams Grove, Owens, Gray, Grizzard, Mason, Yale, Fields Crossroads, Lumberton, Drewryville and Joyner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
